comment.text: Absolutely the best restaurant to eat at when visiting Atlanta. Right next to the st Regis. We've eaten there twice and both times the food, drinks and service has been superb.  Beef cheeks, sea bass or pineapple chicken were delicious.   The signature cocktails were also very tasty.  The only thing negative is they put to much ice in the cocktails for the way I like them.

Oh. My. Goodness. This place is AMAZING! My fianc√©e and I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. We had the Chicken Corn Fritters, Basil Rolls, Pad Thai Noodles, Pineapple Chicken, and THE BEST DAMN OLD FASHIONED IVE EVER TASTED! I enjoyed myself so much that I forgot pictures.

Chai Yo, is a visual delight, from its artfully crafted decor to its very beautifully presented food. A nice addition to the Atlanta restaurant scene in this regard. Starting with cocktails, they are excellent. Infusing Pandan flavor into different drinks is a surprising addition. However, the food isn't as good, probably because a bit too modified to suit the American palette  - too sweet, under seasoned, and unimpressive for anything Thai.  We had the tapioca dumplings for appetizer, which were quite nice, but each one had different consistency in spice levels and amount of filling. The basil rolls are nice, but I have had nicer ones on Buford highway. The sea bass with crab meat fried rice, lacked any seasoning and you start to wonder why is the sea bass just pan fried and nothing more added. Pineapple chicken was just too sweet. Thai lava cake, i.e chocolate cake with pandan ice cream was good. 

Overall, we went to Chai Yo expecting an equal or better experience than their sister restaurant Nan. But, Chai Yo ended up being an overly expensive Tuk Tuk, that stands out for its ambience, but is beaten in taste by its neighbors Tamsung and Bangkok Station.

Never go here! First off on a Friday night they were understaffed at the bar. Basically had to wait 30 minutes once seated for a cocktail. Secondly,  arrive 30 minutes before last call for food and of course due to ridiculous Covid restrictions much of the seating was outside. Dining there myself I requested to sit at a small table, two top, and they said oh no we can't sit you there we're bringing those tables in. Really it's supposed upscale establishment you tell a customer they can't sit at a two top table? Instead, 
 they sent me a four top, Very large, awkward and inappropriate. Food was mediocre at best! Just ordered a couple appetizers and left. Good riddance!
Such a delicious meal at this Buckhead gem! Such incredible flavors and such a nice combination! Really enjoyed the coconut soup especially. Really wonderful experience

My husband and I came here for Valentine's Day and they had the prefixed menu and let me tell you...everything  was delicious!!!!!! We did not  have a dish that we did not like. Our waitress was so attentive and made sure our experience was top notch. I ordered filet mignon as my entree and I got it medium well. Usually when  I go places, they can't seem to get that cook right.  It's either still too much pink or burnt. At Chai  Yo, the cook on it was PERFECT! My husband and I have already decided that we will definitely be coming back to try their everyday menu  and we can't  wait.  The ambience was great and the restaurant was super clean. The only reason I gave them a four because the seating wasn't the most comfortable.
Super chic ..beautiful restaurant. Everything I have ordered is amazing. We have been there 3 times since its opening and everyone has loved the food!

The decor is absolutely beautiful. We had summer rolls, vegetable wontons and octopus as an appetizer. Absolutely phenomenal. Entrees were beef cheek Penang, pad Thai and Kra Pow Talay. All may sound run of the mill but we're elevated and so wonderful. The pad Thai is made with glass noodles and had a spice level that turned in to a slow satisfying burn. Desserts were also memorable especially a mango panda cotta with pistachios.

The food was OK but not great. The service was just bad. Considering that the place was empty on a Friday night I dont understand why we seldom saw our waiter. We arrived at 6:15 and it took 20 minutes to make a drink order. It wasn't until 7 that we were able to order our entrees. In fact the waiter only started to check on us after I left the restaurant to walk around and see if Umi had any openings. Interesting that it takes 45 minutes to take our order, but the food is delivered 5 minutes later.

The lobster soup was pretty good. The crispy duck over noodles had a nice sauce but the duck was not crispy at all. The skin was a little rubbery. The beef cheek panang came out luke warm at best. My wife sent it back and asked if they could just warm it up. It took forever just to reheat a dish. However it did taste really good once it was warm. 

The meal would be one of the priciest Thai meal we have had. I expected it would be due to location and what their menu is attempting. It was also one of the worst with regards to service and meal quality. Considering how empty it was on a Friday night I think Chai Yo may be in trouble.

We went last night for an impromptu date night.  Friendly service from the start.  Our waitress had great food and beverage recommendations which was helpful because my wife does not like meat.  A lot of meals can have meat switched for delicious organic tofu so this .  The veggie spring rolls are delicious!  I had the garlic grouper which was also fantastic!  My wife had the drunken noodles with tofu and that was delicious too!   I also highly recommend the brussel sprouts which were really tasty and perfectly cooked so that they were tender but not mushy.  The old fashion was also tasty!  If you're in the mood for great Thai I highly recommend this spot!
Food was gOod buT not exceptional for prices. I was disappointed as I really had been dying to go there. Service was good. I've just had much better food at other places.

This is the BEST Thai restaurant we have ever been to, and we've been to A LOT (we are huge foodies and are fans of Buddakhan in NYC, as well as the Thai food in San Diego, but if you're in ATL, this place is the best!).  Naan, the same owner, was our prior favorite but this is closer to home and on the same level of deliciousness as Naan (I cant decide which I like better)
Everything we tried was cooked to perfection, never overly sweet or salty-the spring rolls were extra crisp and the dumplings were soft and flavorful but not soggy--the pad Thai, delicious with perfectly thin angel hair noodles that weren't clumped or too sweet--and the lamb chops and sea bass, OUT OF THIS WORLD! If you LOVE Thai food like we do, and you're into hip, sexy restaurants with food that makes your taste buds dance, this is THE PLACE.  My kids, who are huge foodies too, said this was their favorite restaurant (and we've spoiled them with the best restaurants NYC, San Diego, Miami, and the ATL has to offer). The service was exceptional, May and the staff were so customer oriented, we wished they work for us!!

Very limited menu 
The four stars are for the cocktail. I loved the food as well. However the problem is that their food menu is very small. My spouse does not eat sea food so he barely can have two dishes at max. Also not much choice for vegetarians. They need to add at least two more items to their menu one with beef and one veggie. 
You expect every item to be excellent when they have limited options. We were not that pleased with their chicken lettuce wraps

WOW! DeeDee and Aran have created the most amazing Thai restaurant in Atlanta in the heart of Buckhead! The coconut lobster soup was full of lobster and delicious. The tapioca dumplings with cIlantro so fine. The pineapple chicken yummy. We topped off with the  lemon grass lime custard which was to die for. You don't be disappointed.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining with us and the kind words Marilyn!  We look forward to your next visit.  -Chef DeeDee Niyomkul

comment.text: I'm from Houston, came to Atlanta to explore and eat. Accidentally found this place, but I'm so glad that we did. The service was wonderful and welcoming, the food...delicious!!! I have no complaints! We got the chance to meet the owners for a brief moment and they were so nice! I didn't even know who they were until they brought us complimentary ice cream, which was also so delicious! I'm definitely coming back here to dine if I'm ever in Atlanta again

Atmosphere is great. Drinks were 5star for me.
Food was good.. It's overpriced Thai food but what can you do... this America and Buckhead so it is what it is
We got some appetizers which were legit and then shared the sea bass and the lobster khao soi...
I've had better khao soi and really wanted to try this bc I'm a huge khao soi fan but it's hard to find on a lot of Thai menus in the us.. anyway that shit was $45 and for it to be $45 it was too refined and too ... not khao soi. I've had better fa sho. But it was decent. I wouldn't get it again. I'd get that sea bass again though for sure. I'd give this 5 star but that khao soi.... knocked it down.
Service was so great as well. Whoever the host was, salt n pepper hair dude, was so attentive and nice. Everyone was nice af. 5 stars for service even tho I had come back once more and service was  a 2 but look like homeboy was mad so I won't take it personally but nah mean 4 for food but khao soi was a 3 so ima say 4 overall. Ya dig

Amazing Small plates, meals and Spirits!!! The Bar is Going to Be the spot to be after work and on the weekends! The Staff is super knowledgeable and attentive (Jennifer and Michelle )! DeeDee has out done herself AGAIN!!! Thank you Michael for the invite

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining with us Duncan!  We look forward to your next visit.  -Chef DeeDee

comment.text: Great food.  Great atmosphere.  Convenient.  My favorite Thai place in ATL - next to UMI and Chops and on their quality level too.  I will be back often.  #snapper #curryChicken

This is one of our favorite restaurants in Atlanta- the food is always delicious and interesting. The prices are higher for Thai food but I would definitely say the quality, atmosphere and service are worth it. The gluten free and vegetarian options are exceptional. I would recommend making reservations.

I thought that the food was very good, but the service was way overzealous. On a Saturday night, I should be hounded to order after just sitting down. Our server was lovely but kept asking to clear dishes that weren't even finished. When we asked for more time to order, we were barely allowed any. Even after we asked for a minute to look over the dessert menu, one of the chefs came right behind her to ask for our order. For $250 for a Thai dinner for 4, sitting for an hour and a half is not beyond reasonable.
Really enjoyed this new upscale Thai spot. Dishes were excellent. The beef cheeks panang curry are a must. Good ambiance and service was solid. Food was a bit on the pricey side up but well worth it.

We've eaten a lot of Thai food over the years from Asia to the USA but our meal last night was best in class! In our group of five, each of our choices was amazing. Flavors were deep and complex and heat was appropriate. Wines were not overpriced and desert was luscious..what a great night for my 65th birthday!  Thank you Samantha for the wonderful service

I've been looking forward for some time now to try Chai Yo Modern Thai. One of my favorite Thai restaurants, Tamarind, has been under renovation so I found out this is one of the restaurants they own. The decor is really nice and elegant and the staff are very polite and welcoming. Their menu is limited and I didn't see any of my favorite Thai dishes. I understand they're located in buckhead so I expected them to be a bit pricy. Now I don't mind paying that price for good quality food, but unfortunately I was disappointed. I felt that the dishes were not as good as the other two Thai restaurants they own. My pineapple chicken was super sweet  and my husbands pad Thai was pretty bland. I guess I'm use to  authentic Thai cuisine and this restaurant had their own twist to it, which is fine, but I prefer the real deal when it comes to Thai food. If you like Thai with a modern twist then Chai Yo Modern Thai might be up your alley.

When I think of the Thai cuisine scene in Atlanta, the first ones that come to mind are Tamarind, Nan, And Tuk Tuk - at least from a fine dining perspective. They are all owned by the same group and when Tamarind closed down to make way for some much needed renovations at the Colony Square, Chai Yo popped up in its place but a few miles north in Buckhead. When you walk in, you are immediately greeted by the hostesses with warm smiles and gorgeous decor and I give them a 5/5 stars for that. The service is also friendly and the waitress was very knowledgeable and pleasant - also 5/5 stars here. 
However, I was taken aback by the food. This restaurant could not be further from anything Thai I have tried and been accustomed to. I ordered the Pad Thai and it was lacking in flavor. My wife was all excited about getting her favorite dish - Chicken Panang, but was disappointed that they only offered 2 options - Beef Cheeks Panang & Chicken Green Curry. Not wanting to take any chance, she ordered the pineapple chicken and that was also lacking in flavor and super sweet to the point of being a dessert. And to top it all off, their dishes were pricey but that is expected from any fine dining restaurant in Buckhead. In retrospect, should have walked 100 yards further and indulged in sushi.

Fun, friendly and delicious!  I sat at the bar...alone. Always challenging for me to feel comfortable. The staff was super accommodating and very friendly. They also had recommendations for a cool cocktail lounge for me to go to after my dinner.
This is a.fancy restaurant. It is fairly dark inside Service is quick and efficient . Food is ok nothing to shout about . It is pricey for the quality and quantity of the food

Reservation at 7:45, was sat immediately upon arrival. Our waitress was extremely nice. The food was 5 stars all the way from beginning to end! For appetizers we had the tapioca dumplings, which was a s. When you first bite into it, you won't taste anything but then the flavors develop in your mouth and it is out of this world. For entrees, my husband had the lobster dish with side of fried rice and I had the pad thai. I thought we were going to share food with one another but I love my pad Thai so much and he loved his so much that we just scratched that idea lol. I thought I was completely stuffed after my entree, but then my husband ordered the Thai lava cake and coffee ice cream. Man oh man.... forget the stuffedness... the coconut ice cream, the whipped cream and the chocolate cake was divineeee. I had to divulge with no regrets. This place is by far the best Thai restaurant in town!

I took my friend here for his birthday, and everything was top notch! We ate outside on the patio (6 ft apart), It was a Saturday evening, and they had live music outside, The lamb chops were soooo very yummy, and perfectly prepared! The pan seared scallops were really good too! Nice place to bring a date!

I liked it here. Great atmosphere and interior design. Good service, drink list and food options. Had the lobster soup which was great and then sea bass entree. I liked it. Good for groups and also for one on one meals. There is also a small bar too for eating and drinking.  Good addition of much needed ethnic food to the neighborhood !
I've been here 3 times and had incredible food, amazing service, and an excellent atmosphere each time. I recommend this place to all my friends. Keep up the good work, Chai Yo!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much for your kind words! We strive to provide exceptional dining experiences for everyone that walks into our establishment! We hope to you see and your friends soon. -Chef DeeDee Niyomkul

comment.text: So glad this restaurant opened at this convenient location, tried nearly everything on the menu for dinner with my family and would highly recommend everything. The only thing to avoid maybe the steak since it's not really a Thai dish. Even the waitresses are authentic. Great experience, wonderful food. Their lunch box is petite but sufficient and great value.
Chai Yo was a great place to catch up with a friend. The service at the bar was excellent and the atmosphere was awesome. The Chicken Siam and Beef Panang were both very good. I'll be back!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining with us Ian! The beef panang is one of my favorites!  We look forward to your next visit.  -Chef DeeDee Niyomkul

comment.text: Visited Chai Yo on a Friday to see what all the hype was about. The hostess will ask if you want to check your coat at the front when you get there - always a sign of a classy joint. We made reservations and were seated in the first part of the restaurant near a window. The food menu is a one-pager, so there are not too many options. They are lenient with substitutions, so the staff will accommodate to your needs if you have dietary restrictions. We started with the Chicken Lettuce Wraps and some beverages. The main courses we selected were the Khew Wan Kai (green curry chicken) and the Pad Thai (substitute chicken for prawns). The presentation for the starter was appealing, and the egg crepe base layer for the pad thai was a nice touch. I was not too impressed with the green curry presentation. As for the taste, I would say that the chicken used in the starter was the most savory by far. The other two dishes were nothing to write home about. I have had much better at other Thai establishments around the city. If you plan on visiting here, I would not recommend the dishes that we had. What you can enjoy when you visit is the ambiance and service. Side note: valet parking only, costs $2 + gratuity so be sure to bring cash.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining in with us Vats. We hope you will come back and try our other flavorful dishes like the Beef Panang and the Lobster Khao Soi.  -Chef DeeDee Niyomkul

comment.text: Loved it--beautiful space with incredibly prepared takes on Thai cuisine.  Food is beautiful, delicious and well priced.  Super friendly staff helps round out a perfect meal!
Lovely restaurant! The staff was very friendly and the food was excellent! If you're looking for an upscale Thai restaurant, look no further.

Beautifully designed and very kind staff members. However, it was too loud and way overpriced. 

The bad acoustics made our dinner unpleasant since we couldn't hear each other. Also the tables are too close, sort of NY style. 

In regard food, we shared spring rolls as an appetizer. My wife had the pad Thai ($28 for pad Thai) and I had sea bass ($42 for a small portion of sea bass over rice and bok choy). One drink for me and no dessert. 
So one shared appetizer, one drink, two entrees = $120 dinner. 

The food was good but not great. We won't be back!

So excited that I live above this place.  If you love authentic Thai food mixed with a beautiful ambiance/fine dining experience then this is your spot.  They import everything in from Thailand.  The staff is super attentive and friendly.....and I mean entire staff.  Hostess, general manager, head chef/owner, and bartender.  Since I was eating solo I took a spot at the bar and like the food, the cocktails did not disappoint either.  They are located in the same square as Seasons 52, Umi, King, etc.  If you want to do a tester first, go for lunch because they have a $15 lunch box special that lets you sample multiple items off their menu for a very cheap price that will absolutely fill you up.
Incredible service , absolutely delicious Thai food with an amazing atmosphere . Perfect for a intimate date night or group dinner with friends.

Heard great things. Sunday night 7pm reservation, vey empty. Appetizers, lobster soup-very good, octopus salad-very good,
Springs rolls were just like any other spring rolls.
Entre, both chicken curry and lobster curry were very good. Pad Thai was average. I'm used to Pork Belly melting in your mouth, this was very crunchy on outside and very chewy. I've had better.
They also did not have Sapphire gin. That's a little odd.
Fantastic experience from beginning to end. Food and service were top shelf. The restaurant is beautiful as well! Thank you for an amazing dinner!

My friend and I ate here last Saturday night. The atmosphere and service was phenomenal. The food was fantastic. I order the Neau Panang (beef cheeks). I don't recall ever having a meat that was so tender and delicious. Phenomenal dish! I will be back soon.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining with us David!  We look forward to your next visit.  -Chef DeeDee Niyomkul

comment.text: I have been to Chai Yo over 5 times.  For business lunch and family dinner.  The restaurant has outstanding food & cool vibe. A great effort by Chef Niyomkal !

Let me put it this way. The food is the overpriced version of Panda Express. It is so disappointing. In the name of modern Thai, the food is the very opposite of Thai food-- nor refreshing or tasty. Two stars are for the environment.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Ë±°Ê£ã, thank you for taking the time to share your recent dining experience with us. For the past twenty years myself and my family have prided ourselves on providing an exceptional customer experience at our restaurants; however, we obviously failed during your recent visit. We would have been glad to suggest other items on our menu or to re-make any of the dishes you disliked to your satisfaction if you would have expressed your displeasure to a server or management during your dining experience. We would love an opportunity to make up for your unsatisfactory experience and hope you will dine with us again in the future.

comment.text: Thoroughly enjoyed lunch with my friend. Food was tasty, service was great. Drinks could have been better

photos.caption: Sea bass with crab fried rice- delicious

comment.text: We had a very good meal here this evening. I ordered the pork belly and it was terrific. Very flavorful and unique. My wife ordered Pad Thai and it was very good as well. The Pad Thai comes with large shrimp which is always a classy touch. The drinks were also terrific and a very unique selection that pair well with a good Thai dinner. The service could've been a little attentive but we will certainly be back ASAP.

Super pretentious and overrated restaurant. My wife and I went in during the opening week of the restaurant and I was wearing my esports team bomber jacket since it was chilly outside. Went in and the decoration was nice and fancy, but it was chilly inside as well. As we sat down, I believe it was the maitre D asked me to remove my jacket since they are an upscale restaurant. I looked around and there was maybe two tables occupied with customers at the time... I said I'd prefer to keep it on since it was kind of chilly... couple minutes later he came back and said that they'd prefer me to remove my jacket as it was their opening week and they want to keep an upscale image. Keep in mind that my jacket was nothing out of the ordinary and it looked more like a sport coat than a bomber jacket. Anyway my wife and I decided to just listen to them and order the food. The food was terrible in comparison to any other Thai restaurant you ever go to.... my wife ordered the pad Thai that said it had jumbo shrimps... the entree came and there were no shrimps to be seen.... we had to send it back...Then the bill came and it was extremely overpriced.... I would not recommend any asian food lovers or any food lovers in general to visit this restaurant ever... it is pretentious, overpriced, overrated, and last but not least the food was not even up to par with a Thai takeout restaurant.

Chai Yo is an excellent upscale Thai dining experience. The cocktails were innovative and refreshing, the appetizers (the star being the Lobster Tom Kha Soup- savory lobster coconut soup) were delicious and our entrees were incredible. We ordered the Pork Belly, Pad Kee Mow and Seabass Garlic- each were prepared very well and we savored each bite. The dessert is a must try- I suggest the Pandan ice cream and Thai Coffee Lava Cake. Lastly, the service was phenomenal- Lai had our food out quickly and checked on us regularly. I definitely suggest Chai Yo!

This was the most flawless dinner I have had! Right from being greeted by the hostess and Manager to finishing the meal. Even when we were being sat, the Manager saw a couple tiny water spots on the table and said oh hey I see some water spots let me get that. Attention to detail! Then came the appetizers. We have the chicken corn cakes and basil rolls, soooo good! So flavorful! The sauce that comes with the basil rolls is a good amount of spice but even more flavorful, I'd buy that in bottle! Then I got the curry lobster tail noodle dish. It quickly jumped to the top of my favorite seafood meal in Atlanta. The tail was hearty, cooked perfectly and perfect flavoring. My boyfriend got the pork belly with basil fried rice. It was a completely different flavor from mine but just as delicious! Chai-Yo, well done!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining with us Maddy!  We look forward to your next visit.  -Chef DeeDee Niyomkul

comment.text: This place is so delicious! It's the closest to Thai food from Thailand I've had and it's location in Buckhead is perfect. If you're looking for fine Thai dining- this is it!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining with us Jeevitha! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed everything. We look forward to your next visit! -Chef DeeDee Niyomkul

comment.text: Best Thai food I've had in Atlanta. Very cool presentation with the food too. Pineapple chicken was amazing.
